Source : Rossiyskaya Gazeta | News

Translation : The Russian Far East was the first in Russia to begin celebrating Spring and Labor Day. After a two-year hiatus due to coronavirus restrictions, May 1 in every major locality will be a procession of labor collectives, concerts, master classes, and many other festivities.

Source : Rossiyskaya Gazeta | News

Translation : A subspecies of the Omicron strain BA.2, Stealth Omicron, is the most infectious variant of the coronavirus. This was stated by Kamil Khafizov, head of scientific group for development of new diagnostic methods based on sequencing technologies of the Central Scientific Research Institute of the Russian Federal Consumer Rights Protection and Human Health Control Service (Rospotrebnadzor).

"The proportion of BA.2 has steadily increased, reaching more than 90% of all new cases, which is fully consistent with the information that stealth-omicron is the most transmissible we have seen in the history of the pandemic," Khafizov noted.

Original : https://t.me/rgrunews/45348

Translation : The ruble zone will start operating from May 1 in the Kherson region, which has been liberated from Ukrainian nationalists. The transition period will take up to 4 months, during which time the ruble and hryvnia will be in circulation in the region, after which the settlements will be only in rubles.

At first, the Russian International Settlement Bank will organize both cash and non-cash payments.

Translation : Forwarded from Kremlin Laundry

âï¸ It is extremely important for Russia not to let the Arctic issue translate into a military confrontation with Western countries. In case of build-up of the Russian military presence in the Arctic it would be easier to get support for inclusion of Sweden and Finland into the North Atlantic Alliance. Experts believe that such support has already been received, and the accession is inevitable, regardless of whether Russia strengthens its military presence in the Arctic or not. Russia's military response will follow inevitably and will involve strengthening the infrastructure of the nuclear deterrent forces in the region.

Source : Moscow region Z today

Translation : Meteorite unearthed in a vegetable garden sold for half a million in Shchelkovo

A resident of the village of Trubino in the urban district of Shchelkovo put up for sale an interesting find from his vegetable garden - presumably, a meteorite. A few years ago he was working on his dacha, and the stones were preserved for several years... Until the owner suddenly noticed that one of them was glowing.

- I looked, there was something metal. I took a magnet and it worked. I decided to take it to the lab, and they confirmed that it was 98% pure iron. Even an angle grinder couldn't cut it. We don't have any metal-working plants in our area, and I found it at a depth of two meters. I think it's definitely a meteorite," said Alexander, the "lucky man" himself.

The artifact man put up for sale on one of the sites. He set a hefty price of 500 thousand rubles. So far there are no buyers, but the seller is ready to bargain.

@mosregtoday

Original : https://t.me/mosregtoday/6097

â¼ï¸ How to get "paternity capital"

From May 1, 2022 there will be more reasons for fathers who are raising children alone to receive maternity capital. They will be entitled to maternity capital if their mother, who is a citizen of a foreign country, dies.

How does a father apply for maternity capital?

An application for the certificate can be submitted in a personal office on the portal of state services.

If the applicant wishes, it is still possible to apply in person to a regional branch of the PFR or the MFC. The Pension Fund will independently check all necessary data via interdepartmental interaction channels.

A similar procedure for the provision of state support is already in place for fathers to whom the right to a certificate was transferred after the death of a Russian citizen mother.

It should be reminded that the right to receive maternity capital is still available only to women who are citizens of Russia, who gave birth to their first, second, third or subsequent children.

This right passes to the father of the children in the event of the death of the mother, if she had such a right and did not have time to exercise it.

Source : The Horde

Translation : Dear friends, a word of support to you from the Swiss Roche.

"Hello, dear friends in Russia. My name is Roche and I come from Switzerland. I am a man who has long ago separated from this Western system. The values of the West have been devalued. It is clear to me that we are manipulated and deceived. But I can think for myself. And I know what the Russian people, the Russian world has done for us and will do more. And for that I am very grateful to you. You must remain steadfast. You are the last bastion of the struggle for civilization, for tradition and culture, which has been shamelessly devalued in the West. God will protect you, my brothers and sisters. And God will protect your army. I send you much love. I hope that the bond between our souls will never be broken. God protect you. Thank you."

Roger, thank you very much! We will do our best to make sure that the cultural and civilizational bridges between our countries are not burned.

Dear friends, Roche also asked me to tell you that he is not alone, that many in the West sympathize with Russia.

[Horde] - native, malignant, yours

Translation : ðºðºð¦ The Southern Operational Command of the AFU reports another strike on the Russian Armed Forces' positions on Snake Island.

As usual, they talk about "big losses", but it turns out exactly the same story for internal consumption, as with Chernobaevka: they hit the white light as a penny. On April 26, UC "Yug" claimed almost identical data, which wander from report to report.

There is an interesting nuance: it is not clear what they were hit with. The Ukrainian information bureau never missed an opportunity to boast about their achievements, but now it gives some kind of a cramped summary.

So there may have been strikes, but whether only the Ukrainian side was involved is a big question.

In Makeyevka, a child killed by the Ukrainian Armed Forces was bid farewell.

Today, April 30, a ceremony was held to say goodbye to 11-year-old Alexei Kaminsky, who was killed on April 28 as a result of shelling of Makiivka by Ukrainian punitive forces.

âï¸Socially important in laws in May:

- Low-income families will begin receiving monthly payments for children ages 8 to 17. You can apply from May 1 on the portal of public services or write an application in PFR or MFC. Such state support is provided to families with an average income per capita below the subsistence minimum. The payment will be based on a comprehensive needs assessment, i.e. the family's income and assets as well as the parents' employment will be taken into account.

- Members of flight crews of civil aviation aircraft and workers in the coal industry will have their monthly pension supplement recalculated. They are entitled to it due to harmful, dangerous, strenuous and difficult working conditions. The size of payments will be adjusted four times a year - on February 1, May 1, August 1 and November 1.

- Social payments initiated by the president and the government can no longer be written off to repay loans and in the framework of enforcement proceedings. The exceptions will be if the borrower himself agreed to it. Also, payments to the poor in the framework of state social assistance will be protected from write-off.

- Local authorities will be able to refuse to install advertising structures
